word: Go now to the death-bed of a Christian -- Halburton of Scotland.  He was in poverty, and was suffering great pain.  He had none of the comforts that Voltaire possessed, but he was infinitely richer.  He said: "I shall shortly die.  In the resurrection I shall come forth to see my God and to live forevermore.  I bless His name that I have found Him, and I die rejoicing in Him.  I bless God that I was ever born."
